definition: lit. old general/commander-in-chief 將帥|将帅, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess/fig. old-timer/veteran

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: I had to listen to the manager and players like Giggsy – he gives me advice all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我请教过经理和老将，他们总是给我建议。

sentences.english: One night, Zhou Yu was thinking hard in his tent about how to defeat Cao Cao's army, when Huang Gai came in .
sentences.chinese: 一日深夜，老将黄盖来到帐中，商议破曹以火攻为好。

sentences.english: The old veteran could tire out the most robust sportsman.
sentences.chinese: 这位久经沙场的老将能把最强壮的运动员拖得筋疲力。

sentences.english: The performance also secured a raft of records for veteran Wu.
sentences.chinese: 这一成绩也让老将吴敏霞创造了一系列纪录。

sentences.english: Finley is expected to sign for the prorated veteran minimum.
sentences.chinese: 芬利可能在几天内签一份老将底薪合约。

sentences.english: This is a story from Three Kingdoms. Huang Zhong, a veteran in the army of Shu, was one of its top five generals.
sentences.chinese: 黄忠是蜀军中有名的老将。

sentences.english: This is a story from Three Kingdoms. Huang Zhong， a veteran in the army of Shu， was one of its top five generals.
sentences.chinese: 黄忠是蜀军中有名的老将。

sentences.english: He navigates celebrity dinner galas like a seasoned politician.
sentences.chinese: 他游刃有余地参加名流晚宴，宛如政坛老将。

sentences.english: The world by tomorrow tired, spring bitter autumn comes after veteran to.
sentences.chinese: 世人苦被明日累，春去秋来老将至。

sentences.english: All mortals are tired for the sake of tomorrow
sentences.chinese: 世人若被明日累，春来秋去老将至。

sentences.english: Rock and roll veteran Keith Richards has a cameo as Captain Jack's father.
sentences.chinese: 摇滚老将基思理查兹拥有作为杰克船长的父亲客串。

sentences.english: However, the United manager insists his longest-serving player still has an important job to do at Old Trafford.
sentences.chinese: 不过，曼联经理说这位老将还是要在曼联工作。

definition: (in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
(sports) member of the national team/national representative/(medicine, chess etc) one of the most highly skilled practitioners in one's country
troop arrangement/battle formation/lineup (of a sports team etc)
